intro: Cuphea chiquitensis, commonly known as the Chiquitanejo cuphea, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Bolivia and Brazil. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade conditions.
